alert.note: Alert for Middlesex; Monmouth (New Jersey) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Philadelphia - Mount Holly (New Jersey, Delaware, Southeastern Pennsylvania)
info.headline: Flash Flood Warning issued January 01 at 11:46PM EST until January 02 at 2:45AM EST by NWS Philadelphia - Mount Holly
info.description: ...FLASH FLOOD WARNING REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL 245 AM EST SUNDAY FOR NORTHERN MONMOUTH AND MIDDLESEX COUNTIES... At 1146 PM EST, local law enforcement reported flash flooding in the North Brunswick and New Brunswick areas. A trained spotter reported nearly 1.5 inches of rainfall in one hour in Keyport in Monmouth County. Between 1 and 2 inches of rain have fallen. Flash flooding is already occurring. HAZARD...Flash flooding caused by heavy rain. SOURCE...Law enforcement reported. IMPACT...Flooding of small creeks and streams, urban areas, highways, streets, and underpasses as well as other drainage and low lying areas. Some locations that may experience flash flooding include... New Brunswick, Perth Amboy, Long Branch, Asbury Park, Sandy Hook, Edison, Middletown, Old Bridge, East Brunswick, Sayreville, North Brunswick, and Marlboro. This includes the following highways... New Jersey Turnpike between exits 9 and 12. Interstate 287 in New Jersey between mile markers 0 and 4. Garden State Parkway between mile markers 101 and 132. FLASH FLOOD...OBSERVED
info.instruction: Turn around...don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles. Be especially cautious at night when it is harder to recognize the dangers of flooding.
